snippet: Researchers discover a circuit in the brains of mice that tells them whether or not they’re thirsty.
abstract: Dr Yuki Oka study in journal Nature reports that circuit in brains of mice known as subfornical organ, or SFO, controls thirst by determining when hydration is required.
lead_paragraph: Researchers discover a circuit in the brains of mice that tells them whether or not they’re thirsty.

headline.print_headline: Animal Behavior: Leading a Mouse to Drink, or Not
headline.main: Leading a Mouse to Drink, or Not
